result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

to Withdraw

Status conference on September 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Attorney Philip Edward Marry in court with Defendant Austin M. Perez.  Clerk: PU
  Minutes:  Atty Marry moves to withdraw as parties have not been able to meet and DE is unable to afford him.  Court grants motion to withdraw.  DE states he will be applying for a public defender and the Court orders him to report to SPD today.  Court will follow up with SPD to ensure he reported to SPD  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Marry.   Clerk HMcBride.   Atty Marry requests adjmt for reasons stated on the record.  Granted. PTC 7/8 930am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.  kmk
